clinical_study.brief_title: Evaluation of the Change of Penile Corpus Cavernosum After Caudal Block Using Ultrasonography in Children

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to evaluate the change of penile corpus cavernosum after caudal block using ultrasonography in pediatric patient.

primary_outcome.description: Evaluation of the change of penile corpus cavernosum after caudal block using ultrasonography in children
Evaluation of the change of penile corpus cavernosum after caudal block using ultrasonography in children
Evaluation of the change of penile corpus cavernosum after caudal block using ultrasonography in children

secondary_outcome.description: Investigation of cavernosal arterial hemodynamics included peak systolic velocity [PS], end diastolic velocity [ED], mean velocity [MV], time-averaged maximum velocity [TAmax], time-averaged mean velocity [TAmean], pulsatility index [PI], volume flow [VF], and dorsalis pedis artery diameter [D].

Investigation of cavernosal arterial hemodynamics included peak systolic velocity [PS], end diastolic velocity [ED], mean velocity [MV], time-averaged maximum velocity [TAmax], time-averaged mean velocity [TAmean], pulsatility index [PI], volume flow [VF], and dorsalis pedis artery diameter [D].

Investigation of cavernosal arterial hemodynamics included peak systolic velocity [PS], end diastolic velocity [ED], mean velocity [MV], time-averaged maximum velocity [TAmax], time-averaged mean velocity [TAmean], pulsatility index [PI], volume flow [VF], and dorsalis pedis artery diameter [D].

arm_group.description: pediatric patients who need urologic surgery and caudal block

study_pop.textblock: pediatric patients who need urologic surgery and caudal block

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
1. Twenty (ASA status I or II) children, ages 2 to 7 yr old, who were scheduled for a urologic surgery
2. Children who needed caudal block for postoperative analgesia
Exclusion Criteria:
1. if there were contraindications for caudal block including hypersensitivity to any local anaesthetics, bleeding diathesis, infections at the puncture sites, or pre-existing neurological disease.
2. patients scheduled for penile surgery

facility.name: Department of Anesthesiology and Pain Medicine, Yonsei University College of Medicine
